name: Holiday Inn & Suites Front Royal Blue Ridge Shadows

reviews.title: A really good Holiday Inn
reviews.text: The reviews here are right on. The lobby is impressive and the room looked new and clean and very comfortable. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a good feeling right away. After a day of traveling it was great to land here and so convenient to have a good restaurant right there. Definitely recommend!

Wonderful hotel to stay at, one night or longer!! Great location, away from the city, with a restaurant connected to the hotel. The hotel staff were great and helpful, with very clean rooms, and a very safe environment. Will definitely be staying there again.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my fiance to Front Royal for the caverns and Skyline drive. The Hotel was amazing from the front desk all the way to the room. When you drive up to the hotel you know you made the right choice. The room was amazing! We had a nice view of the golf course and the mountains. Even being close to highway you would of never known. The indoor pool and the hot tub were great also! The water temperature was perfect even though there was a drastic temp change there the pool and hot tub were great! Houlihan's was a phenominal resturaunt! The service was great! The food was amazing! You get what you pay for there. We ate there 2 times and both times it was amazing! Just watch out for the appetizers they make them for 4 people. But it was still good. The managers on duty were very polite and involved with the customers. I would definelty go back. It is such a convience to have such a wonderful restraunt on the premesis. I couldn't ask for a better experience in Front Royal. I would like to thank Holiday Inn for making a great stay for my fiance and I.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY!!!!!

reviews.text: This hotel is located in the heart of town, right off the interstate with places to eat and shop nearby. This is a convenient place to stay if you are headed to the Skyline Drive along the crest of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Shenandoah National Park. Very clean, nice rooms and has a restaurant/bar located in the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is fairly new and quite clean. We had a nice view overlooking the golf course. The reception staff might need a few lessons in how to act in front of customers. There were not rude or indifferent but acting like silly teenagers at camp and discussing their private life quite loudly and openly, but they were helpful so I kind off left it to their young age. The pool area was nice but the water felt "oily": not sure if that is the nature of a salt water pools. Overall, an OK place to stay
reviews.title: No surprises
Horrible customer service - traveler beware!
reviews.text: The place had great appearance, enjoyed the restaurant and it was clean. My credit card was charged twice due to a web site error in reservation processing. Holiday Inn required that the Hotel property generate the refund for the double billing. The manager at the hotel took my call, said they needed to look into the situation. I never got a return call, I had to follow up several times to get back in touch with the manager. Once getting through to Shirley, the manager, she declined to honor the refund. Called corporate - they identified where the problem in the reservation was, saw how it happened and still did not honor a refund. The Holiday Inn does not value repeat business or long term customer relationships - they would rather keep their $145 opposed to creating a satisfied customer! Traveler beware..!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of a road trip from the UK to Washington and Virginia. The hotel's appearance was excellent, the rooms were spacious and spotless. The on site restaurant was more than adequate with excellent service. So far so good, then the fire alarm sounded in the late evening and we had never experienced such disorganisation.
reviews.title: Very nice but beware of the fire alarm procedure or lack ot it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The alarms do not sound inside the rooms only in the coridoors
reviews.title: Super nice and cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. There was no direction from any staff as to where to assemble.
reviews.title: Clean + Friendly n Efficient Staff = Happy Us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. One older guest was hyperventilating and it was one of our party who came to her aid as there were no staff to be seen
reviews.title: Brand new hotel overlooking golf course

reviews.text: This place is more like a 5 stars,clean,nice people. we stop for the night on our motorcycle and when it started to storm real bad they let us put on bike under a overhang, you wont find a better place,so dont bother looking. great place. all we can say is "WOW"
reviews.title: WOW WOW WOW

reviews.text: I am in the Air Force, so naturally, we travel a LOT. By far this was one of the best hotels we have had the pleasure of staying at. The staff was very professional, courteous, and friendly. The hotel overlooked the Front Royal Golf Course...nice views. The hotel and rooms were very clean. Houlihan's served AWESOME dinners, and their staff was equally accommodating. We had a birthday celebration for our daughter in our room, and forgot to bring plates, forks, etc. Houlihan's graciously hooked us up with everything we needed. I highly recommend the Front Royal Hotel Inn and Suites to anyone traveling through!!!!!!
reviews.title: One of our best stays EVER!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is a very clean and very nicely kept hotel. The service is very helpful and top notch. There is a resturaunt on site (a Houlihans). Overall a great place to stay. I would stay here in a heartbeat if in the area again.
reviews.title: Very nice place to lay your head to rest.

reviews.text: I took my wife and our young daughter here for a long weekend hiking in the Shenandoah in early May. We had a pleasant stay. It's a new property with plenty of space in the rooms (and the bathrooms), in the lobby and it has a Houlihan's restaurant attached. It's approximately 10 minutes north of the center of Front Royal. We found it easy to get there for restaurants and easy to get onto US-522 and US-340 to access Shenandoah Park.
reviews.title: Pleasant, spacious, clean hotel near Shenandoah

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The exercise room and indoor pool areas are spacious. In addition, a long patio extends along the outside of the hotel just outside the pool area. It faces west over the adjoining golf course, which looks like it's creatively sited in a former gravel pit. It's a beautiful view over the course, up the hill to the west, and towards the ridges of West Virginia.
reviews.title: Comfort and Convenience at its best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Shenandoah Valley for the July 4th long weekend. We stayed at Holiday Inn for 2 nights. It is a new hotel, so everything is very clean. The view from the rooms are really good. The gold course and the sunset view is excellent. We also liked the hot tub and swimming pool. The staff were very friendly. It is a little far from the the skyline or the valley, but in a newer neighborhood with multiple food options near by. I would completely recommend this place to stay,. I paid 80 USD a night and booked via priceline name your price option. i think it was a fair price for the hotel standard, however, it would be better if we had free breakfast included. the cost of breakfast was 12 usd, and 25 id you ordered room service.
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last Saturday (7/16) to rest before hitting Skyline Dr on our Goldwing. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the next day, everything was perfect! They let us leave our Goldwing under the portico which took a load off my mind. The pool area was great and the terrace outside the pool area was a perfect place to unwind after a long day of riding from Connecticut.
reviews.title: What a GREAT place to stay!

reviews.text: We ate at Houihan's which is next door so that made it convenient for us also. The room was perfect as was the mattress. We slept very well!
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: Thank you Holiday Inn and Suites! You made us feel very special!
reviews.title: If you're on a budget, I could recommend this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had the opportunity to stay here prior to heading out on the Skyline Drive & it was simply outstanding! Hotel was easy to find, plenty of parking, beautiful grounds alongside a golf course, moder & extremely clean.....I could go on & on as obviously I became a fan & to top it all the price was very reasonable. If you need a place to stay book it here.
reviews.title: Loved it - Go here

aka: Holiday Inn & Suites Front Royal Blue Ridge Shadows Hotel
description: Welcome to an award winning hotel. The Holiday Inn & Suites Front Royal Blue Ridge Shadows is the recipient of the 2012 and 2011 IHG Torchbearer Award (among the Best Holiday Inns) and 2010 IHG Newcomer Award (among Best New Holiday Inns). Sophistication and natural beauty unite at this Front Royal, Virginia hotel. For sophisticated but affordable accommodations, look no further than the Holiday Inn & Suites Front Royal Blue Ridge Shadows. We're situated above the award-winning Blue Ridge Shadows Golf Club and surrounded by the beautiful mountains of Front Royal, VA. Our hotel's location is ideal for travelers to immerse themselves in the outdoors. You can take a leisurely drive on Skyline Drive to experience breathtaking views, enjoy a canoe trip on the beautiful Shenandoah River or explore the caverns around Front Royal. Lodging here is also convenient for business travelers visiting the Virginia Inland Port, Ferguson Enterprises, Family Dollar, Toray, American Woodmark, DuPont and other businesses in Front Royal. Our 24-hour business center, free high-speed Internet access, heated indoor pool and 24-hour fitness center are available for your use. Overlooking the beautiful mountains around Front Royal, our hotel rooms and suites offer triple-sheeted bedding, 32-inch LCD flat screen TVs with HD and HBO and refrigerators. From Houlihan's Restaurant and Bar, serving made-from-scratch cuisine three meals a day, to our 4,500 square feet of meeting space for hosting your special event, this Front Royal hotel's amenities provide a relaxing environment for our Virginia guests.
